title: Calories in 1 lb Ground Beef
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 lb ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: 80% lean/20% fat ground beef, cooked (pan-broiled), drained of excess fat; 1 lb = 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, draining, and brand. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 1 lb of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1153 kcal and ~109 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison; scaled from per-100 g basis.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 lb of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1153 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 lb ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 109 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”90% lean has fewer calories (~215 kcal/100 g) than 70% lean (~300 kcal/100 g).

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked; raw is lower in calories per gram but shrinks during cooking.

faqs.q: How does cooking method change ground beef nutrition?
faqs.a: Broiling or baking drains more fat than frying, reducing calories; always drain excess.
